Abstract

NEPOMUCENO, Juliana Leite. Produ√ß√£o de biomassa guiada por princ√≠pios de sustentabilidade: influ√™ncia de fatores abi√≥ticos, efluentes industriais e municipais na utiliza√ß√£o biotecnol√≥gica de cianobact√©rias. Tese (Doutorado em Ci√™ncias) ‚Äì Escola de Qu√≠mica, Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, 2021.

Cyanobacteria are important photosynthetic prokaryotes, which stand out for presenting metabolic activity superior to terrestrial plants, without competing for land with agriculture, contributing to the reduction of CO 2 expenses. By using solar energy to synthesize biomolecules (carbohydrates, lipids and proteins), cyanobacteria present themselves as a potential raw material for bioenergy production. However, large -scale energy applications require high biomass productivity , high -yield conversion process es and reduc ed input use. In this context, the impact of abiotic factor of cellular stress (NaCl) and use of residues, specifically sugar cane vinasse, digestate from anaero bic digestion of cyanobacteria (FLD) and municipal wastewater , is investigated. The work evaluat es the biofixation of CO 2 in a synthetic medium with reduced nutritional content (BG -11), industrial effluents and municipal wastewater . The impact of salinity was evaluated at concentrations of 20, 60 and 100 mM NaCl , in strains Synechococcus subsalsus , Anabaena siamensis and Anabaena variabilis . NaCl increased the content of carbohydrates, as a compatible solute, in the evaluated concen tration range. Cultivation strategies with industrial effluents included the acclimatization of A. siamensis in sugarcane vinasse at 3% (v/v) and in FLD + BG-11, which showed formation of biomolecules (carbohydrates and proteins) superior to control c ultur es (BG-11), with higher biomass productivity in 20% FLD + 80% BG -11. Municipal wastewater applications, as a sustainable alternative to the use of water and synthetic nutrients, were successful in cultivating A. siamensis without autoclaving. The se experiments followed Experimental Design 32, evaluating the %BG11 (10, 30 and 50%) and irradiance (50, 120 and 190 Œºmol photons m-2 s- 1). The assays showed a correlation between biomass and biomolecules productivity (lipid s, carbohydrates and proteins) wi th high irradiance (190 Œºmol photons m-2 s-1). A. siamensis also showed phy coremediation efficiency, with removal of COD (60%) in municipal wastewater , reduction of Nitrate (44%) and Phosphate (93%). From the Response Surfaces generated to predict Specific Growth Rate, Biomass Productivity, %Lipids, %Proteins and %Carbohydrates, statistically viable predictors were generated and used to optimiz e the cultivation of A. siamensis in munici pal wastewater for Biogas production .
Keywords: 1. Cyanobacteria; 2. Photoautotrophic Cultivation; 3. Abiotic Factors; 4. Industrial Effluents; 5. Municipal Wastewater ; 6. Phycoremediation ; 7. Biomass Optimization .
